ECE3062 Electronic systems and control - Semester 2 (S2-01) - 2017
The unit further explores the integration of multiple devices on a chip. MOS and BJT single ended
as well as differential amplifier circuits
column2: along with basic analogue circuit blocks like the current
are introduced and developed using small signal models. Practical Operational Amplifiers

column1: are considered where properties deviate from ideal in terms of frequency response
stability and input/output impedance. The use of feedback in electronic circuits is studied
ways to improve arising stability issues in operational amplifiers (eg using pole compensation) are
discussed. Nyquist is presented and frequency domain analysis and design shall be explicitly
explored via Bode plots. Concepts of State Space representation

column2: observability and controllability and discrete-time systems are presented.
3 hours laboratory/practice classes and 7 hours of private study per week

Note: that not all stage 1 competencies are relevant to each unit.

Face-to-face lectures will provide a learning environment for theoretical fundamentals of the unit.
Several active learning and engaging strategies such group discussion
pair-share and informal quiz are embedded to the face-to-face lectures to enhance students
learning experience. These active learning and engaging strategies are also expected to provide
Tutorials will provide an opportunity for problem-based learning; taking the concepts from the
lectures and providing concrete examples of their application.
Laboratory-based classes will also provide a problem-based learning environment with elements of
enquiry-based and hands-on approaches. They allow students to work on their skills in analysis.
